statements: SELECT * FROM EmployeeAccess
SELECT employee_id, username, access_level FROM EmployeeAccess
SELECT username, last_login, access_level FROM EmployeeAccess WHERE access_level > 1
SELECT * FROM EmployeeAccess ORDER BY username DESC, access_level ASC
SELECT employee_id, username, last_login FROM EmployeeAccess WHERE last_login > '2021-01-01'
SELECT * FROM EmployeeAccess WHERE access_level > 1;
SELECT username, access_level FROM EmployeeAccess WHERE last_login >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT employee_id, username FROM EmployeeAccess ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeAccess WHERE employee_id = 001;
SELECT MAX(access_level) AS highest_access_level FROM EmployeeAccess;
SELECT * FROM employees
SELECT employee_name, employee_role FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, employee_role FROM employees ORDER BY employee_name DESC
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE supervisor_id IS NOT NULL
SELECT employee_name, employee_role, department_id FROM employees WHERE department_id = 2
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1 ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, employee_role, department_id FROM employees WHERE employee_role = 'Manager' ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT employee_name, employee_role, department_id FROM employees WHERE supervisor_id IS NOT NULL AND department_id = 2;
SELECT employee_name, department_id FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (1, 3, 5) AND employee_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT employee_name, employee_role, department_id, supervisor_id FROM employees WHERE department_id NOT IN (4, 6);
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees;

SELECT employee_name, permission_type FROM employees JOIN employee_permissions ON employees.employee_id = employee_permissions.employee_id JOIN permissions ON employee_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;
SELECT employee_name, department, access_level FROM employees WHERE department='HR';
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE permission_type='READ';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE access_level > 2;

SELECT employee_name, department, permission_type FROM employees JOIN employee_permissions ON employees.employee_id = employee_permissions.employee_id JOIN permissions ON employee_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;

SELECT employee_name, description FROM employees JOIN employee_permissions ON employees.employee_id = employee_permissions.employee_id JOIN permissions ON employee_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id WHERE employee_name LIKE 'S%';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_permissions FROM employee_permissions WHERE employee_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE id = 1;
SELECT permission_name FROM permissions WHERE permission_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM roles ORDER BY role_name DESC;
SELECT e.name, r.role_name FROM employees e JOIN employee_roles er ON e.id = er.employee_id JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.role_id;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY name DESC, id ASC;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT employees.name, roles.role_name FROM employees JOIN employee_roles ON employees.id = employee_roles.employee_id JOIN roles ON employee_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;

SELECT employees.id, employees.name, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM employees JOIN employee_roles ON employees.id = employee_roles.employee_id JOIN roles ON employee_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN permissions ON roles.role_id = permissions.permission_id;
SELECT DISTINCT department FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department='Sales';
SELECT employee_id, name, email FROM employees WHERE department='HR' ORDER BY name;
SELECT employee_id, department, email FROM employees WHERE name LIKE '%John%';
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE description IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT name, email FROM employees WHERE department = 'Engineering' ORDER BY name DESC;

SELECT e.name, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM employees e JOIN employee_roles er ON e.employee_id = er.employee_id JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.role_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.permission_id;

SELECT e.name, COUNT(rp.permission_id) AS total_permissions FROM employees e JOIN employee_roles er ON e.employee_id = er.employee_id JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.role_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id GROUP BY e.name HAVING total_permissions > 2;
